title: Coleen Rooney can only be played by Jodie Comer in Netflix drama we all deserve
text:
Coleen has accused Rebekah of selling stories Picture: Karwai Tang/WireImage)

Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy’s clash appears to be having more of an impact on the UK than Brexit and, naturally, we’re all desperate to know who will be playing the original WAG in the Netflix series we all deserve. Everyone’s first pick? Fellow Scouse Jodie Comer, obviously.

Earlier today, Wayne Rooney’s wife accused Rebekah of leaking personal stories from Coleen’s Instagram account to the press, which the I’m A Celebrity star has vehemently denied.

Regardless, tea has been spilled, popcorn is being devoured at a record rate and Netflix have teased they’re already planning the true crime expose of the millennium.

Surely a Ryan Murphy drama is looming and there’s really only one woman who could possibly nail the complex re-telling of this cut-throat game of cat and mouse, and that women is Jodie.

Advertisement

Advertisement

At least according to fans, who have beckoned on the Liverpudlian to land what will no doubt guarantee another BAFTA, Emmy and inevitable knighthood.

‘I can’t wait for the Jack Reacher/Coleen Rooney spin-off franchise, with @jodiecomer as Coleen and Scarlett Johansson as Reacher because she can play anything. #ColeenRooney,’ crired one superfan of the war of the WAGS, which was immediately followed by: ‘Can the next series of Feud be about Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy and have Coleen played by Jodie Comer?’

Can the next series of Feud be about Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy and have Coleen played by Jodie Comer? — Levi (@scally_cinnamon) October 9, 2019

I can’t wait for the Jack Reacher/Coleen Rooney spin-off franchise, with @jodiecomer as Coleen and Scarlett Johansson as Reacher because she can play anything. #ColeenRooney https://t.co/ITv5pjEd5z — Rachel Parris (@rachelparris) October 9, 2019

Just seen a tweet stating that Jodie Comer should play Coleen Rooney in the Netflix series about today's breaking news & I'm sorry but I'm here for it. pic.twitter.com/iCq3i0e3OA — Kelly Welles (@kelly_welles) October 9, 2019

At the time of writing, hundreds of requests are coming in thick and fast and now, Jodie, we’re looking at you.

Make it happen.

Coleen broke the internet this morning when she released a statement on her Instagram, which read: ‘For a few years now someone I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family – all without my permission or knowledge. After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion.

Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy have broken the internet (Picture: ITV/Backgrid)

‘To try and prove this, I came up with an idea. I blocked everyone from viewing my Instagram stories except ONE account. (Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven’t had stories on there for a while.)’

The mum-of-four continued: ‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories if they made their way into the Sun newspaper. And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house.

‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to. Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’

Coleen captioned the statement: ‘This has been a burden in my life for a few years now and finally I have got to the bottom of it……’

Rebekah fired back in her own statement, writing: ‘As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this. I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me over the years can vouch for.

WAGs Coleen and Rebekah crossed paths at football matches when their husbands were playing (Picture: Mark Large/Daily Mail/REX/Shutterstock)

‘If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped. Over the years various people have had access to my Insta and just this week I found I was following people I didn’t know and have never followed myself.’

Advertisement

The reality star continued: ‘I’m not being funny but I don’t need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you? I liked you a lot Coleen and I’m so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I’m heavily pregnant.

‘I’m disgusted that I’m even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened.’ She concluded her post with a broken heart emoji.

What a time to be alive.
